revised_title: Tone Perception in Gammarus pulex: A Study on the Tonal Sense in Aquatic Species
tldr: The study investigates the tonal sense in Gammarus pulex, a type of aquatic crustacean. The author found that these animals can perceive and respond to specific tones, particularly the bass note of the B flat. The response is associated with a physiological status of the animal itself, and the auditory function is generally located in the first antennae. This research provides insights into the auditory capabilities of aquatic species.
